alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Chuska Mountains; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Estancia Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued May 20 at 9:56AM MDT until May 20 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West-southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, north central, northwest, and west central New Mexico. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs may be blown down. Expect strong crosswinds on area roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hazardous crosswinds are expected along north-south and northwest-southeast oriented roads such as U.S. Highway 491 in northwest New Mexico and Interstate 25 from Santa Fe to Albuquerque and Belen.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.
